subject: Travel
title: Fridtjof Nansen's Frozen Drift
description: A micro-lesson that makes Fridtjof Nansen's Frozen Drift usable.

hook.text: In 1893, Norwegian explorer Nansen deliberately froze his ship into Arctic ice.

buildup.text: His theory was that ocean currents would carry the trapped ship across the North Pole.

discovery.text: The ship, Fram, drifted for three years. The crew studied ice, weather, and ocean depths.

twist.text: The drift missed the pole, so Nansen left the ship and skied toward it with one companion.

climax.text: He reached 86¬∞N, closer than anyone before, then survived 15 months camping on the ice.

punchline.text: He let the ice carry him farther than any engine could.

quiz.question: What was Nansen's unusual strategy for polar exploration?
options: Freezing his ship into ice to drift
